snippet: The Cambodian government will ask the Metropolitan Museum of Art to return twin sandstone figures that were allegedly looted from a jungle temple.
abstract: Cambodian government plans to ask the Metropolitan Museum to return two life-size 10th-century statues that it claims were looted from a jungle temple; sculptures have anchored the museum's Southeast Asian galleries for decades; case illustrates Cambodia's growing interest in restoring its cultural heritage.

byline.original: By TOM MASHBERG and RALPH BLUMENTHAL

lead_paragraph: The Cambodian government will ask the Metropolitan Museum of Art to return twin sandstone figures that were allegedly looted from a jungle temple.

headline.seo: Cambodia to Ask Met to Return 10th-Century Statues
headline.main: Cambodia Says It Seeks Return Of Met Statues
headline.print_headline: Cambodia Says It Seeks Return Of Met Statues
